titlestmt.titleproper: Brainard, Charles Henry, 1817-1885. Charles Henry Brainard papers, 1795-1884 (MS Am 889.14-889.16): Guide.

titlepage.titleproper: Brainard, Charles Henry, 1817-1885. Charles Henry Brainard papers, 1795-1884 : Guide.
titlepage.author: Houghton Library, Harvard College Library

did.repository: Houghton Library, Harvard College Library, Harvard University
did.unittitle: Charles Henry Brainard papers,
did.abstract: Autograph album (1858-1884), a letter book (1855-1883), and a scrapbook of letters and autographs (1795-1857 and undated) of American print dealer, publisher, and historian, Charles Henry Brainard.

processinfo.p: Processed by: Alison Harris, Peter K. Steinberg, and Bonnie B. Salt

acqinfo.p: No accession number. Bequest of Evert Jansen Wendell; received: 1918.

accessrestrict.p: There are no restrictions on physical access to this material.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation for Publication:
prefercite.p: Charles Henry Brainard Papers, 1795-1884 (MS Am 889.14-889.16). Houghton Library, Harvard University.

bioghist.p: Brainard (1817-1885) was an historian, print dealer, and publisher as C.H. Brainard Publishing Co., in Boston, Massachusetts. In 1885 he wrote: John Howard Payne, a biographical sketch of the author of "Home , sweet home", ...

arrangement.p:
Arranged in call-number order:
MS Am 889.14: Autograph album
MS Am 889.15: Letter book
MS Am 889.16: Scrapbook and index

scopecontent.p: Includes three volumes: an autograph album (1858-1884), a letter book (1855-1883), and a scrapbook of letters and autographs (1795-1857 and undated).

The autograph album (MS Am 889.14) contains autograph quotations or sentiments, signed, from Matilda Goddard, Jacqueline Pendleton, Rufus Dawes, S. E. Sewall, Thaddeus Hyatt (dated 3 Apr. 1860 at the Washington jail), Anna E. Dickinson, W. H. H. Murray, and others; with a photograph of Hyatt, signed, addressed to Brainard.

The letter book (MS Am 889.15) contains letters to Brainard written to Brainard from John Whittier, Charles Sumner, William Burleigh, Celia Burleigh, Rufus Dawes, George Ripley, and others; with a portrait print of Ripley.

The scrapbook (MS Am 889.16) contains letters, few to Brainard, and cut-out signatures from Noah Webster, Washington Allston, Jared Sparks, John Pierpont, and others. The autographs of Eliza Leslie, John Whittier, Thomas Read, Horace Greeley, and others are accompanied by portrait prints. A typescript list of autographs was inserted the front, now removed to separate folder.

did.head: (MS Am 889.14)
did.unittitle: Brainard, Charles Henry, 1817-1885. Autograph album, 1858-1884.

note.p: Contains autograph poems, quotations, or sentiments, signed and dated. Most often the text is copied and is not original to the author. Also includes a carte-de-visite photograph.
Includes the following items [blank pages have not been listed]:

did.unittitle: Mackay, Charles, 1814-1889. Returning messengers : autograph manuscript poem, 1858.
Cary, Phoebe, 1824-1871. Trust : autograph manuscript poem, 1867.
Janvier, Francis De Haes, 1817-1885. Alas! That friendship's fragile flowers [first line] : autograph manuscript poem, 1858.
Bailey, Gamaliel, 1807-1859. What to other men would be no duty [first line] : autograph manuscript, 1859.
Dawes, Rufus, 1803-1859. A farewell : autograph manuscript poem, 1858.
Giddings, Joshua R. (Joshua Reed), 1795-1864. God and nature [first line] : autograph manuscript, 1858.
Bodichon, Barbara Leigh Smith, 1827-1891. A love of nature [first line] : autograph manuscript, 1858.
Southworth, Emma Dorothy Eliza Nevitte, 1819-1899. Asperations are prophecies : autograph manuscript, 1858.
Mario, Jessie White, 1832-1906. Endurance is the crowning quality [first line] : autograph manuscript, 1859.
Tindleton, Jacqueline. Educate your women, as they have authority to be respected [first line] : autograph manuscript, 1859.
Sewall, Samuel E. (Samuel Edmund), 1799-1888. Justice is the everlasting and immutable [first line] : autograph manuscript, 1860.
Sewall, H. W. Life's garlands fade and fall too fast [first line] : autograph manuscript poem, undated.
J.T. Cognacq (Paris), photographer. Thaddeus Hyatt : carte-de-visite photograph, 1863.

note.p: Recto signed by Hyatt and inscribed: "La Rochelle 14. Dec. '63."
Verso inscribed: "Presented to Ch. H. Brainard by his sincere friend Thaddeus Hyatt."

did.unittitle: Hyatt, Thaddeus. He that is true to himself is true to God [first line] : autograph manuscript, 1860.
Garrison, William Lloyd, 1805-1879. To Thaddeus Hyatt : autograph manuscript poem, 1860.
Tilton, Theodore, 1835-1907. Infidelity is the religion of [first line] : autograph manuscript, undated.
Barry, Charles A., 1830-1892. F. H. B. In paradise- : autograph manuscript poem, 1862.
Kimball, Josiah F. As wanderers seek some mill they oft have tasted [first line] : autograph manuscript poem, 1861.
Whittier, M. F. What is man, or the son of man? [first line] : autograph manuscript, 1861.
Slack, Charles W. (Charles Wesley), 1825-1885. Weak men have wishes; strong men wills [first line] : autograph manuscript, 1861.
Goddard, Matilda. Our future may seem defeat but [first line] : autograph manuscript, 1862.
Hunt, Harriet H. God's completeness round out incompleteness [first line] : autograph manuscript, 1862.
Sargent, John T. (John Turner), 1808-1877. There is no power outside of the church [first line] : autograph manuscript, 1862.
Carpenter, F. B. (Francis Bicknell), 1830-1900. The possibilities opened up to the human family by a true [first line] : autograph manuscript, 1864.
Joyce, Robert Dwyer, 1836-1883. Thou ran she 'till she plucked his gown again [first line] : autograph manuscript poem, 1878.
Dickinson, Anna E. (Anna Elizabeth), 1842-1932. All the world's a stage, & all the [first line] : autograph manuscript, undated.
Burleigh, Celia, 1825-1875. The home is to each human soul the [first line] : autograph manuscript, 1871.
Owen, John, 1806-1882. To John Greenleaf Whittier: On the seventieth anniversary of his birthday December 17, 1877 : autograph manuscript poem, 1878.
Cook, Joseph. Duty done is the soul's fireside [first line] : autograph manuscript, 1878.
Trowbridge, J. T. (John Townsend), 1827-1916. Religion is no leaf of faded green : autograph manuscript poem, 1878.
Whiffle, E. P. In all the autographs [first line] : autograph manuscript, 1879.
Perkins, Frederic B. (Frederic Beecher), 1828-1899. As I am no poet, as facts [first line] : autograph manuscript, 1879.
Shillaber, B. P. (Benjamin Penhallow), 1814-1890. An art creed : autograph manuscript poem, 1879.
Murray, W. H. H. (William Henry Harrison), 1840-1904. Character dictates destiny [first line] : autograph manuscript, 1878.
Clemmer, Mary, 1839-1884. Tis not the thought that Jesus died : autograph manuscript poem, 1881.

note.p: Also with autograph of Gustavus A. Somerby pasted to page.

did.unittitle: Gallagher, William D. (William Davis), 1808-1894. The brown thrush : autograph manuscript poem, 1882.

note.p: With a clipping which includes The brown thrush.

did.unittitle: Burnett, Jerome C., 1833-1891. Magnolia : autograph manuscript poem, 1884.
Rice, Albert. Life's autumn : autograph manuscript poem, 1884.
